title: Calories in Beef Tenderloin
meta_description: Learn calories in beef tenderloin per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts for better meal planning.
assumptions: Beef tenderloin steak, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 1/8 inch fat, cooked by broiling; all grades.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat trimming, cooking method, and source. Check labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked beef tenderloin provides ~271 kcal and ~25g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Lean only, fully trimmed of visible fat
Add 1 tsp butter per 100g during cooking
Grilled with marinade (1 tbsp soy sauce per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g beef tenderloin?
faqs.a: About 271 kcal for cooked beef tenderloin with some fat.

faqs.q: Is beef tenderloin high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~25g protein per 100g, making it a lean meat option.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in beef tenderloin?
faqs.a: Approximately 18.6g total fat per 100g, including 7.7g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in beef tenderloin?
faqs.a: Yes; broiling or grilling keeps it lower than frying, which adds fat.

faqs.q: How does trimming fat change beef tenderloin nutrition?
faqs.a: Trimming reduces calories to ~190 kcal per 100g and lowers fat significantly.
